item.title: Bollard bent out shape, 8th September
item.description:
Another report dated July says several of these bollards are missing/removed and this final one is bent out of shape. Can this be removed and replaced please? This looks dangerous and for such a main town centre location it is very poor it has been neglected for many months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, East Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Junction of Granville Road and Cambridge Road, 8th September
item.description:
This rubbish has been like this for days. The bin men have been today and left it like this. Not a very good job I'm going to report this to my local MP. Area is a mess at the best of times!!!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cambridge Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Large - More than a van load

item.title: Graffiti on Redriff Road, 8th September
item.description:
There is graffiti in two places along Redriff Road, roughly opposite Ropemaker Road and the entrance into Russia Dock woodland. It’s on the opposite side of the road from there, on a retaining wall. Same type of graffiti in both locations, as shown in pics. Please remove as soon as possible, before the idea catches on with other ‘artists’…Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More business rubbish, 8th September
item.description:

item.title: Brambles hanging over footway, 8th September
item.description:
Brambles with nasty thorns are hanging from the garden hedge above the footway. Anyone walking into them could be badly scratched. They belong to the house on the corner of Chilthorne Close and Ravensbourne Park Crescent.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 85, Ravensbourne Park Crescent, Honor Oak, London

item.title: Yellow bin at 51 bus stop overflowing, 8th September
item.description:
Yet again reporting bun at 51 bus stop outside 17 hook lane is overflowing . This is also located near a school , why can’t this bin be emptied every other day at least as it is always Full and has heavy use . Come on Bexley council , give us value for money council tax

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
